main.name: Salman A
main.description: Here will be your description. Use this to describe what you do or whatever you feel best describes yourself to a potential employer
main.bio: Use this bio section as your way of describing yourself and saying what you do, what technologies you like to use or feel most comfortable with, describing your personality, or whatever else you feel like throwing in.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

resume.skillmessage: I'm a tech geek who is always searching for new technologies. These are the ones that I use the most these days.

education.description: Describe your experience at school, what you learned, what useful skills you have acquired etc.
Describe your experience at school, what you learned, what useful skills you have acquired etc.

work.title: Senior UX God
work.description: Describe work, special projects, notable achievements, what technologies you have been working with, and anything else that would be useful for an employer to know.

work.title: Junior bug fixer
work.description: Describe work, special projects, notable achievements, what technologies you have been working with, and anything else that would be useful for an employer to know.

skills.name: Python
skills.description: Python is my favourite programming language. It is by far the language I am most familiar with in terms of data-structure and algorithm programming.

skills.name: Solidity
skills.description: Solidity is a programming language designed for developing smart contracts that run on Ethereum. I did my last project with it and it was fascinating.

skills.name: C++
skills.description: C++ is the language I trust the most. It is reliable, insanely powerful and looks cool and geeky!

skills.name: Git
skills.description: I use Git all the time before you never when you'll mess things up. I have used Git for all my recent projects and it has been really helpful.

skills.name: MySQL
skills.description: MySQL is my database of choice. It's simple, easy to understand and effortless to integrate.

skills.name: Heroku/Netlify
skills.description: I use Heroku/Netlify for hosting platform most of my projects because they are so easy to deploy, even deploy automatically from GitHub, and maintain. Plus, the free tier is really good.

skills.name: ReactJS
skills.description: I recently started tinkering with ReactJS and its dependencies. It is an amazing tool for building powerful web apps effortlessly.

skills.name: Django
skills.description: I discovered Django and how good it is while doing an assignment a while ago. A single framework that can build fully functional web app is pretty intriguing. I'm currently learning more.

projects.title: Grocery Bag
projects.category: A Django web app for storing your Grocery shopping lists

projects.title: TravelMate
projects.category: A website wanderlusts by wanderlusts. (not deployed yet)

projects.title: Resume Website
projects.category: A React based personal resume and portfolio website.

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Salman must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
